intro: Alchemilla subcrenata subsp. atlantis, commonly known as the Atlantis lady’s mantle, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its silver-gray, hairy leaves that are deeply lobed and often covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
